mcq.statement: What does the idiom 'be glad to see the back of' mean?

options.a: To be happy when someone arrives
options.b: To be pleased to see someone leaving
options.c: To be indifferent to someone's presence
options.d: To be watchful of someone's actions

mcq.one_liner: The idiom 'be glad to see the back of' means to be pleased when someone undesirable is leaving or has left.
